intro: Calyptranthera sulphurea, commonly known as the sulfur-flowered calyptranthera, is a herbaceous plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Melanthiaceae and is characterized by its delicate, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodland understories. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged alternately along the stem. Calyptranthera sulphurea is known for its subtle fragrance and is often found in association with other shade-tolerant flora.
